channel.title: Conor Lamb's Blog
channel.description: Recent content on Conor Lamb's Blog

item.title: September 2024: Conor's Monthly Retrospective
item.description: Goals Met: ~85% Song Of The Month (listen while reading!): 1000 Times - Big Blood - Indie Pop Summer is officially over so it’s time to get back to work. How did I do with last month’s goals? Work None this month. Music - Solo Project | Band Project Release Chlorine Videos Results: A I edited the videos for my new single. I also made a plan for when to release them with a focus on iterative improvement of views and learning how to release tiktoks/reels.

item.title: August 2024: Conor's Monthly Retrospective
item.description: Goals Met: ~50% Song Of The Month (listen while reading!): Thieves Like Us - New Order - Post Punk? Typing this up from my lovely beach holidy in Sicily. The room is kind of cramped and the wifi meh, but the headspace is unbeatable üèñÔ∏è How did I do with last month’s goals? Music - Solo Project | Band Project Fully Plan Out Release Chlorine Results: B- The song is completely mastered, although I’m not sure its perfect.

item.title: July 2024: Conor's Monthly Retrospective
item.description: A bit of indecision on moving forward with projects, and slow progress, but fun summer activities.

item.title: Faster PRs - Lower The Barrier Of Entry
item.description: Reviewing pull requests is a pain in the hole, but a necessary one. It is also massive time sync if you’re actually doing it right. Normal PR Process It often looks like this: Get slack message: ‚Äúpwetty pwease review my PR :3 pr link‚Äù Open in browser, scroll through the code a bit Inner Monologue: ‚ÄúThis looks mostly understandable? Can I can get away without pulling this locally?‚Äù Decide to run it locally Stash current branch’s changes (remember that you have a stash saved!

item.title: June 2024: Conor's Monthly Retrospective
item.description: June was hella busy with fun stuff and admin for switching jobs.

item.title: April/May 2024: Conor's Monthly Retrospective
item.description: 2 months with lots of travel and starting a new job.

item.title: On Getting Discovered
item.description: I blog sometimes. I publish a good bit of music as well, and yet, no one knows me. This is fine. I happily mosey through life without internet celebrity, but candidly (and probably humanly), it would be nice to get recognition for the things that I make. So how does one get “discovered”? Youtube just recommended me this small linux youtuber, who struck me with a Jimmy Neutron style, brain blast on how these algorithms likely work.

item.title: January 2024: Conor's Monthly Retrospective
item.description: 2 months with lots of travel and starting a new job.

item.title: 2023 Goals Review, 2024 Goals Plan
item.description: I achieved 1 goal, and the rest were meh.

item.title: Making A Language Learning Buddy w/ ChatGPT
item.description: I’m at a quietly frustrating point with my German language learning. It’s an uncomfortable expanse within A1-A2 levels where I pick up a myriad of words in a conversation, but I’m still not confident enough to say much. The usual solution here is one of brute force. Go make a fool of yourself, often and brazenly, in the wild. Talk to people around you, have awkward-as-hell conversations. But, how can I cash in on the ChatGPT hype that way?

item.title: How to make a free resume website and blog in 10 min for programmers (or people unafraid of the command line)
item.description: See the website you‚Äôre reading this on? I didn‚Äôt make this in 10 minutes‚Ä¶. But I sure could have if I had this tutorial. So here‚Äôs how you can make your own customizable resume website or blog for free in 2021 using the Hugo framework, a few commands in the terminal, Github Pages to host it. Skip to Part 1: Let‚Äôs make a website if you wanna skip my banter üòî
